definitions.text: an essay or article that gives a critical evaluation (as of a book or play)
a subsequent examination of a patient for the purpose of monitoring earlier treatment
(accounting) a service (less exhaustive than an audit) that provides some assurance to interested parties as to the reliability of financial data
a variety show with topical sketches and songs and dancing and comedians
a periodical that publishes critical essays on current affairs or literature or art
a summary at the end that repeats the substance of a longer discussion
(law) a judicial reexamination of the proceedings of a court (especially by an appellate court)
practice intended to polish performance or refresh the memory

examples: the platoon stood ready for review
we had to wait for the inspection before we could use the elevator
She reviews books for the New York Times
I reviewed the material before the test

definitions.text: look back upon (a period of time, sequence of events); remember
examples: she reviewed her achievements with pride
